channel.title: My Instant Messenger!
channel.description:
Alright, I will show you what I have been working on for the last 3-4 days.
It is an instant messenger.. just fixing a small login error :) alright wait please.. will be avalabale for dl in a lil..
EDIT:
alright, new features added:
-enter for send -enter for login -login with no name glitch fixed -login while not connected glitch fixed.. -more features to come!
Thank you very much to imafatmess for looking around for glitches.. I really appreciate people who do that kind of stuff.

alright now i wont release anything until i add super stuff!!! rofl i mean a lot of stuff… in a week i will add a new thing

Read full topic

item.title: My Instant Messenger!
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

now running, seems very good! lol, two more things which could be done, make it so the register and login buttons aren’t even clickable when it cannot connect and also make it possible to see who is online and make it so if you click “Type Here” in the chat menu, it removes the text automatically, otherwise, it seems very good!

It might also be a good idea to make something to handle the server being stopped as if I stop the server whilst talking to myself of this, the chat dialogue kind of screws itself over by repeating the last typed message continuously

Read full topic

Anyway, I’ll try running the server now, see how it fares…[/quote]
alright thanks ill try to get on right now too u run the server though

item.title: My Instant Messenger!
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

[quote=“imafatmess, post:8, topic:134097”]Right, it says this in the debug box…

Welcome!
Error connecting!

Obviously a connection error… :S

It also says this in command prompt: “at Messenger.run(Messenger.java:207)” and it continually says it (I can’t stop the program early enough to see the error as it fills command prompt with this so fast.

Anyway, I was fiddling with the login screen, testing stuff and it allows you to enter no username or password and you can click register (it says "Successfully registered user " if you do) and it also allows you to seemingly login, as it comes up with the chat dialogue (even if it is unable to connect). Also, it would be useful if you can just press enter again on the login screen to login…[/quote]
@Error connecting… if im not running the server… u shud be

@useful suggestion alright ill work on that

@glitch with login with " ". Ill fix that, its a small problem for later…

@login glitch, without connecting " WTF!? " rofl… its only supposed login if it gets the message!

fixed all those small glitches… now someone please add me on msn russiankid_2@hotmail.com

thank you very much

EDIT: imafatmess there is something about you on first post

Read full topic

item.title: My Instant Messenger!
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

Right, it says this in the debug box…

Welcome!
Error connecting!

Obviously a connection error… :S

It also says this in command prompt: “at Messenger.run(Messenger.java:207)” and it continually says it (I can’t stop the program early enough to see the error as it fills command prompt with this so fast.

Anyway, I was fiddling with the login screen, testing stuff and it allows you to enter no username or password and you can click register (it says "Successfully registered user " if you do) and it also allows you to seemingly login, as it comes up with the chat dialogue (even if it is unable to connect). Also, it would be useful if you can just press enter again on the login screen to login…

Read full topic

alright brb,

and added a fix for an error, it used to read the same error again and again… so now it doesnt… someone post here if you want to go and try it

item.title: My Instant Messenger!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

First of all, your server code will only allow one connect at a time. I suggest you use a while loop that keeps listening for multiple connections.

And, what exactly is the following used for:

	private void start() {
		new Thread(this).start();
	}

You really only need one Thread for each connection and one main Thread to handle all the connections.

Read full topic

item.title: My Instant Messenger!
item.dc:creator: @imafatmess imafatmess
item.description:
@imafatmess wrote:

I can log on perfectly, but when I try to send a message, it wont send it (as far as I know) because it isn’t going into the text box above the send buttons. Also, to make it easier to send messages, I’d add a hotkey (or whatever they’re called) to make the enter on the keyboard call the send event… understand?

Read full topic
